response.answer_text: Q: How does rejecting science make America great? The states has about 1/25th of the world’s population. Let’s be generous and call it 5% of humanity. And yet, in most areas, 50% or more of the top universities are in the USA. Medicine, physics, astronomy, materials sciences, etc. There is zero indication that “America rejects science”. The statement “rejecting science” sounds like something picked up in a media story. And unsurprisingly, ironically even, is a non-scientific claim, with no data or study to back it up. Go figure. Just a baseless accusation. Flawed.

How does “rejecting science” come into a Quora question? Well I guess it has to do with “climate change / global warming - because of human activity”. One of greatest (actual) scientific minds alive today from Princeton University explained CO2 is really lower than we need it at 400 ppm. (Better at 1200 ppm). Checkout Professor Happer on YouTube. “Accepting science” is President Trump’s greatest single accomplishment in 1st term of 2 amazing terms. Yes - Republicans acclaimed SCIENCE.
